instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the gene feature selection model based on the PCA algorithm and multicolor QDs immunobiosensor for gastrointestinal tumor markers?
Output: Four kinds of spectrum were used in the gene feature selection model based on the PCA algorithm and multicolor QDs immunobiosensor for gastrointestinal tumor markers. These spectra were 525 nm Cd Se/Zn S QDs-carbohydrate antigen 125 (QDs525-CA125 McAb), 605 nm Cd Se/Zn S QDs-cancer antigen 19-9 (QDs605-CA19-9 McAb), 645 nm Cd Se/Zn S QDs-anticancer embryonic antigen (QDs 645-CEA McAb), and 565 nm Cd Se/Zn S QDs-anti-alpha-fetoprotein (QDs565-AFP McAb).

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the gene feature selection model based on the PCA algorithm and multicolor QDs immunobiosensor for gastrointestinal tumor markers?
Output: Principal component analysis (PCA) and a multineighborhood rough algorithm were used in the gene feature selection model based on the PCA algorithm and multicolor quantum dots (QDs) immunobiosensor for gastrointestinal tumor markers.

instruction: What metric was chosen and how far can this metric go in the gene feature selection model based on the PCA algorithm and multicolor QDs immunobiosensor for gastrointestinal tumor markers?
Output: The metric chosen was the number of selected characteristic genes, and it can go as low as 6 in the gene feature selection model based on the PCA algorithm. In the multicolor QDs immunobiosensor for gastrointestinal tumor markers, the metric chosen was the wavelengths with a wavelength interval of 40 nm for fluorescence spectrum detection.

instruction: How were the quantum dot-antibody conjugates identified and quantified in the gene feature selection model based on the PCA algorithm and multicolor QDs immunobiosensor for gastrointestinal tumor markers?
Output: The quantum dot-antibody conjugates were identified and quantified using fluorescence spectroscopy and ultraviolet absorption spectroscopy. These techniques allowed for the measurement of the fluorescence values and absorption spectra of the conjugates, respectively. By analyzing the fluorescence and absorption data, the researchers were able to determine the presence and quantity of the quantum dot-antibody conjugates in the system.

instruction: Can the gene feature selection model based on the PCA algorithm and multicolor QDs immunobiosensor be used to detect gastrointestinal tumor markers using spectroscopic methods, and if so, how does it compare to traditional detection methods?
Output:
Yes, the gene feature selection model based on the PCA algorithm and multicolor QDs immunobiosensor can be used to detect gastrointestinal tumor markers using spectroscopic methods. The study mentioned in the text utilized fluorescence spectroscopy and ultraviolet absorption spectroscopy to identify and quantify the quantum dot-antibody conjugates.

Compared to traditional detection methods, the results showed that the classification precision of the gene feature selection model (OPCA) in colon tumor and gastric cancer datasets was significantly higher (99.52% and 99.03%, respectively) than that of other algorithms. The classification accuracy was also higher (94.86% and 94.2%, respectively). This indicates that the OPCA model based on the PCA algorithm can obtain fewer feature gene sets and improve the accuracy of sample classification.

Furthermore, the study found that the fluorescence values of the tumor markers reached their maximum when using the QDs-based immunobiosensors. The highest recovery rate of one of the tumor markers (AFP) was 98.51%, and its fluorescence intensity was significantly higher than that of other antigens.

Therefore, the gene feature selection model based on the PCA algorithm and multicolor QDs immunobiosensor shows promise in detecting gastrointestinal tumor markers using spectroscopic methods. It
